etymology.description: 雝(雝) (yōng, "harmonious") originally formed -> phonetic 邕 (yōng, "name") corrupted to 玄 (xuán, "mysterious") in later scripts
etymology.interpretation: The character 雍 began as a variant of 雝 with 邕 as the phonetic component. Over time, this component's shape changed to resemble 玄 due to visual similarity in early scripts, reflecting its phonetic role while introducing a new element.

examples.chinese: 他的仪表雍容(他的儀表雍容)。
examples.english: His bearing is graceful and harmonious.

examples.chinese: 园林设计追求自然(園林設計追求自然)，营造雍和环境(營造雍和環境)。
examples.pinyin: Yuánlín shèjì zhuīqiú zìrán, yíngzào yōnghé huánjìng.
examples.english: Landscape design pursues nature, creating a harmonious environment.
